title: Here's the perfect low-tech solution to the HomePod 'white ring' problem | Trusted Reviews
description:
![HomePod
coaster](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Credit: Pen & Quill

**Having just spent £319/$349 on the Apple HomePod speaker, you probably
didn’t envision forking over another twenty bucks, just to stop it[knackering
your furniture](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-homepod-wood-
furniture-damage-ring-3394561).**

However, following Apple’s admission the speaker’s silicone base is leaving
white rings on users’ wooden furniture, that’s exactly what early adopters are
pondering.

One quick-thinking accessory maker has come up with the solution; a $20
leather coaster that’ll sit beneath HomePod and keep your fancy oil-stained
table free from damage.

American company [Pad & Quill](https://www.padandquill.com/leather-coaster-
for-homepod.html) is currently taking pre-orders for a Leather HomePod
Coaster, in whiskey and chestnut, for $19.95.

**Related:[Apple HomePod review-in-
progress](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-homepod-release-date-pre-
order-price-specs-features-2950931)**

The product description (via
[TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2018/02/15/you-can-buy-a-20-leather-
coaster-for-your-homepod/)) deserves a hat tip here:

“The latest in smart speaker innovation deserves state-of-the-art surface
protection,” it reads.

“Our Leather HomePod Coaster is designed in Minneapolis and handmade by
skilled artisans. You’ll love it, but don’t put a ring on it. Your HomePod’s
new home features durable & luxurious American full-grain leather with an
ultra-soft leather backing because the only rings you should see in your home
this season are of the Olympic variety on TV.”

Essentially this is just a leather coaster you’d find in most home improvement
stores, but well played, Pad & Quill. Well played.

![Pen
Quill](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Apple is currently advising HomePod users that the stains are likely to fade
after a couple of days. However the company says HomePod fans should simply
refinish their furniture(!) if not.

Since the anomaly, further reports have [claimed the Sonos One
speaker](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/sonos-one-white-stains-wood-
homepod-3396911) is also leaving furniture with unsightly white marks. Sonos
has acknowledged our request for a comment but hasn’t yet offered up a
statement.

**Has the ‘white ring’ issue put you off buying a HomePod? Or will you simply
use a go-between to protect your furniture? Let us know @TrustedReviews on
Twitter.**
